entry.title: A good idea comes
entry.content:
How long do you use FLipboard? - What about me, it’s for about half a year. But now, I can’t read news feed in no other reader. So I’ve decided to make a special Flipboard frieldly rss corner. Where all my favorite rss-feeds will be kept, as well as yours. So you could be able to add mine, correctly formated, rss-feeds to your flipboards. I have plans to host my feed parser engine on heroku, and all reparsed rss feeds on github. If any other ideas - write comments.

Thanks.

entry.title: performance increase in cycles
entry.content:
It’s really a easy to increas performance of your programm for about 10%: *just change cycles implementation * First I’ve seen this question on [stackoverflow][], then I’ve decided to check it out using g++ version 4.6.

about tests

test1.cpp (slow one)

#include <vector>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main(void) {
    std::vector<int> numbers;
    for (int i=0; i <1000000; ++i) 
        numbers.push_back(i);
    for (size_t i=0; i <numbers.size(); ++i) 
        numbers[i] += 10;
    return 0;
}

Compile:

g++ -o test1 test1.cpp

test2.cpp (fast one)

#include <vector>
#include <stdlib.h>
int main(void) {
    std::vector<int> numbers;
    for (int i=0; i <1000000; ++i) 
        numbers.push_back(i);
    for (size_t i=numbers.size(); i>0; --i) 
        numbers[i-1] += 10;
    return 0;
}

compilation process:

$ g++ -o test1o0 -O0 test-cycle1.cpp 
$ g++ -o test1o2 -O2 test-cycle1.cpp 
$ g++ -o test1o3 -O3 test-cycle1.cpp 
$ g++ -o test2o0 -O0 test-cycle2.cpp 
$ g++ -o test2o2 -O2 test-cycle2.cpp 
$ g++ -o test2o3 -O3 test-cycle2.cpp

Results

I got really slow computer. It’s acually one of samsung netbooks. So, here is my numbers:

programm average
./test1o0 0.126 0.128 0.125 0.119 0.120 0.135 0.139 0.129 0.128 0.123 0.121 0.139
./test2o0 0.112 0.103 0.124 0.130 0.114 0.120 0.125 0.145 0.103 0.133 0.133 0.134
programmaverage
./test1o2 0.067000 0.049000 0.045000 0.051000 0.044000 0.044000 0.041000 0.047000 0.054000 0.045000 0.051000 0.053000
./test2o2 0.047000 0.046000 0.041000 0.043000 0.058000 0.063000 0.048000 0.054000 0.049000 0.056000 0.041000 0.054000
programmaverage
./test1o3 0.061000 0.055000 0.050000 0.068000 0.049000 0.051000 0.047000 0.044000 0.042000 0.043000 0.048000 0.055000
./test2o3 0.047000 0.076000 0.039000 0.049000 0.041000 0.044000 0.048000 0.045000 0.050000 0.062000 0.044000 0.054000

entry.title: About setting up blog on github with octopress
entry.content:
Most usefull post for me about how to setting up blog on github was here by zhubert But first, to install rvm you should follow this article on rvm.io. But it couldn’t work without this little comment by zx1986 here

oh! it works! you could try this command:

$ rake setup_github_pages
$ Enter the read/write url for your repository: git@github.com:your_username/your_username.github.com.git

you should create a project named “your_username.github.com” first, the full project name is “your_username.github.com”
